column1: The '''Viking Club''' was a club for philologists and historians specializing in Germanic and Scandinavian studies.<ref>{{L
column2: 7}}</ref> It was founded by [[E.V. Gordon]] and [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] when the two were professors at [[University of Leeds
column3: Leeds University]] in the 1920s. At meetings of the club students and faculty would gather to read [[Old Norse
column4: Old Icelandic]] sagas and drink together in an informal setting. Members of the club also invented original songs and poems in [[Old English]], [[Gothic]], [[Old Norse]] and other extinct Germanic languages. A collection of these works was privately published as ''[[Songs for the Philologists]]''.
